intro: Mimulus meteor, commonly known as the "sky lantern" or "cloud flower," is a species of flowering plant in the family Plantaginaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and is characterized by its striking, elongated flowers that resemble small lanterns. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with a distinctive, spurred shape that aids in pollination by insects. Mimulus meteor is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators to garden spaces.
